connect4

Class Connect4NetworkSetup

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.stage.Window
      • javafx.stage.Stage
        • connect4.Connect4NetworkSetup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class Connect4NetworkSetup
extends javafx.stage.Stage
    This class serves as the Stage for the Network Setup dialog box.

    This class presents options for the user to select whether to create a game as a Server or Client, play as a Human or Computer, as well as enter the Server and Port number to connect to.

    User selections can be retrieved via accessor methods included.

    Author:
    Kristopher Rangel

    • Method Detail

      • getCreateToggleRow

        private javafx.scene.layout.HBox getCreateToggleRow()
          getCreateToggleRow

            private HBox getCreateToggleRow ()

          Sets up the 'Create:' row of the Network Setup options.

          These elements are added to in an HBox for uniformity of display. The elements include a Label and two toggle options: Server and Client.

        Returns:
        - the HBox containing the elements of the 'Create' row of options

      • getPlayAsToggleRow

        private javafx.scene.layout.HBox getPlayAsToggleRow()
          getPlayAsToggleRow

            private HBox getPlayAsToggleRow ()

          Sets up the 'Play as:' row of the Network Setup options.

          These elements are added to in an HBox for uniformity of display. The elements include a Label and two toggle options: Human and Computer.

        Returns:
        - the HBox containing the elements of the 'Play as' row of options

      • setScene

        private void setScene()
          setScene

            private void setScene ()

          Sets up the elements on the scene.

          The basic structure of the scene is a VBox with four rows. Each row is a HBox that contains all elements on that row.

          The default server is "localhost" and the default port is "4000".

      • getCreateModeSelection

        public boolean getCreateModeSelection()
          createModeSelection

            public boolean createModeSelection ()

          Getter for user Server/Client selection during network setup.
        Returns:
      • True if 'Server' was selected,
      • False if 'Client' was selected

      • getPlayAsSelection

        public boolean getPlayAsSelection()
          getPlayAsSelection

            public boolean getPlayAsSelection ()

          Getter for user Human/Computer selection during network setup.
        Returns:
      • True if 'Human' was selected,
      • False if 'Computer' was selected

        public java.lang.String getServer()
          getServer

            public String getServer ()

          Gets the user-entered Server.
        Returns:
        - the String value the user entered into the server text box

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
          getPort

            public int getPort ()

          Gets the user-entered port number.
        Returns:
        - the Integer representation of the user entered value in the port text box

      • userHitOK

        public boolean userHitOK()
          userHitOK

            boolean userHitOK ()

          Gets whether the user hit the okay button or the cancel button (or clicked the X to exit)
        Returns:
      • True if the Okay button was clicked,
      • False if Cancel button was clicked, or the window was exited with the 'X' box
